title: rdbase
author: rdbase
created_time: March 08, 2023, 01:38:28 PMLast edit: March 08, 2023, 11:03:10 PM by rdbase
content: This was an interesting set to see late last night while surfing my usual youtube channels seeing a clip of the well-known Bitcoin & Cryptocurrency scam detective Coffeezilla who had inteviewed Sam Bankman Fried right before FTX CEO was set to be prosecuted before the court.He was first mentioned back in November 2022 on the famous podcast hosted by none other than Joe Rogan announcer of the UFC corporation.Talking about how Stephen Findeisen better known by his cyber sleuth name Coffeezilla had exposed and has put authorities on the biggest fraudsters and scammers in the bitcoin and cryptocurrency sector.The full podcast can be viewed here where they discuss the role he played in the collapse of FTX as he crashed the interviews of Sam Bankman Fried several time and even made the former FTX CEO show the kink in his amour when he specifically called him by name and stated to stop coming on there to ask him these type of questions. Nobody else caused the normally scripted SBF to go off his tangent and get upset live on those streams.https://www.jrepodcast.com/episode/joe-rogan-experience-1951-coffeezillaReddit post on the podcast from yesterday:https://www.reddit.com/r/CryptoCurrency/comments/11l86v8/coffeezilla_the_crypto_detective_made_it_on_the

comments.author: YuginKadoya
comments.body: ^Actually, it was a great watch and all of his content was pretty much informative exposing the likes of Sam Bankman Fried, The Paradox Metaverse, and Logan Paul the recent ones that I was curious about and have watched, well, Stephen Findeisen also known as CoffeeZilla surely is exposing the scam before the scam happens, or sometimes giving some narrative information about the scam that has happened and confronting them in making interviews with the scammers, surely it was really a blast to watch Cryptozilla he got a ton of information and getting that information and surely he is great in gathering information that is why this is fun to watch exposing scammer in his channel, Well the recent Joe Rogan episode was about what happened in the recent Joe Rogan podcast and how he exposed, again Sam Bankman Fried and Logan Paul and that Logan Paul will refund $1.3 Million of all bought NFT in his project but surely that isn't happening yet, and the Joe Rogan AI podcast scam where the AI was imposing as Joe Rogan that advertising some products in his podcast which is a deep fake, it was really another fun and informative watch yet again,

comments.author: rdbase
comments.created_time: March 10, 2023, 01:15:58 PMLast edit: March 10, 2023, 04:12:58 PM by rdbase
comments.body: The first time I actually started noticing the cases they were taking on was after watching them talk on another well known podcaster Lex Fridman.Coffeezilla: SBF, FTX, Fraud, Scams, Fake Gurus, Money, Fame, and Power | Lex Fridman Podcast #345https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hi9Rf0oLdHkAt nearly 4 hours long it does take several sessions to get through but very informative and if interested in the subject matter does not take long to get into.But there is a shortened version if you are only concerned about the FTX part of the interview/podcast:The Full SBF and FTX Fraud Saga | Coffeezilla and Lex Fridmanhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZYV0xBxJqNYAs well about frauds known as those Internet Gurus who tell you want you want to hear:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zrzz_YJ3VgwBitboy crypto even had made a video about him because at first they had thought Coffeezilla was doing a hit piece on him:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0jytS-182P8

comments.author: YuginKadoya
comments.body: Quote from: SeeBiscuit on March 10, 2023, 12:45:30 AMI loved this podcast in particular. I made some art inspired by coffeezilla because I am such a huge fan of his work.I call it "Classic Bankman L"Here it is:[img width 200]https://i.ibb.co/X8kncy4/Classic-Bankman-L.png[/img]You can see Coffeezilla in the top left made entirely of gold to symbolize gold standard journalism.Great art actually and surely there are no boundaries with his Youtube journalism and exposing those scammers and sometimes interviewing the likes of SBF Andrew Tate and Logan Paul in particular in what they have done with their platforms well Coffeezilla is a unique Youtuber for sure he angered Sam Bankman Fried in an interview and questioning Logan Paul where is the money on the NFT's that was sold to his followers, and surely because of what he is doing he is getting lawsuits left and right because of his investigative work and informative platform there are many that want to shut down and silence him so this is not really a Youbter's dream of a life so I really salute him for this, I think you should make your art a masterpiece print then send it to Coffeezilla as an appreciation on his work, Quote from: rdbase on March 10, 2023, 01:15:58 PMThe first time I actually started noticing the cases they were taking on was after watching them talk on another well known podcaster Lex Fridman.Coffeezilla: SBF, FTX, Fraud, Scams, Fake Gurus, Money, Fame, and Power | Lex Fridman Podcast #345https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hi9Rf0oLdHkAt nearly 4 hours long it does take several sessions to get through but very informative and if interested in the subject matter does not take long to get into.But there is a shortened version if you are only concerned about the FTX part of the interview/podcast:The Full SBF and FTX Fraud Saga | Coffeezilla and Lex Fridmanhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZYV0xBxJqNYAs well about frauds known as those Internet Gurus who tell you want you want to hear:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zrzz_YJ3VgwBitboy crypto even had made a video about him because at first they had thought Coffeezilla was doing a hit piece on him:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0jytS-182P8The one that I am watching right now was an old video about Andrew Tate's motivational teachings that surely let someone be more successful like Tate, which is kind of delusional and he explained why this is truly just a cult group Andrew Tate is making, which is really absurd for people to engage, but there are still many that are led to this kind of nonsense and Coffeezilla is exposing this kind of activity that Tate is giving to his audience, This is what people love about Coffeezilla this is not an ordinary scammer his dealing with but is the most well-known personality Social Media influencer, Artist, Businessman, and Celebrity there is no said limit to what he can contain as long as it involves scamming people, in regards to his own security,

comments.author: YuginKadoya
comments.body: Quote from: SeeBiscuit on March 12, 2023, 02:53:53 AM@YuginKadoya,Thanks, that means the world to me! I would love to have my art piece seen by him, but getting his attention might not be so easy haha  .Yes, I wholeheartedly agree that there are no boundaries when it comes to online journalism. YouTube is a massive platform backed by Google, making it the video version of searching stuff on the internet. You can literally find anything on there, INCLUDING Coffeezilla. That guy is just on fire right now with all of the content, investigations, and memes coming from him. He doesn't work alone, however. He is teamed up with content creators such as XQC, Moist Critical, SomeOrdinaryGamers, Asmongold, and Ludwig. I featured all of them in the piece of Fan Art I made.I also agree with you when it comes to Coffeezilla's fearlessness. The man just ISN'T afraid of calling out the bad players! God bless that man, we need fifty more just like him. We need to be fighting the fight for good. We need to be weeding out every person that wants to make money off of telling retail investors straight up lies about the space we care so dearly about.Hey No problem man, your art was really great and I think that Coffeezilla will really like it, and yes he can not do this alone for sure he surely has a team that is backing him up with the research and stuff like that was pretty much a good team to have and to be part of your wonderful art, actually, I really think Coffeezilla is a good person that many was helped in appealing with the scammers what he really wants to say, and his interview with Joe Rogan is really amazing to watch there are some very informative things that they have tackled,Well, there are other scammer buster Youtuber out there but not like Coffeezilla if Scammer Payback is targeting a call center in India and hacking their system Coffeezilla is targeting well-known personnel which is more dangerous because they can harm you physically because they know who you are, worst well known to be targeted with death threats, even so, Coffeezilla is fearlessly ditching those and go on with life,

comments.author: Hydrogen
comments.body: Quote from: rdbase on March 08, 2023, 01:38:28 PMThis was an interesting set to see late last night while surfing my usual youtube channels seeing a clip of the well-known Bitcoin & Cryptocurrency scam detective Coffeezilla who had inteviewed Sam Bankman Fried right before FTX CEO was set to be prosecuted before the court.He was first mentioned back in November 2022 on the famous podcast hosted by none other than Joe Rogan announcer of the UFC corporation.Joe Rogan is a multi millionaire through his deal with spotify.His net worth could be greater than $200 million.QuoteJoe Rogan Deal With Spotify Is Actually Worth More Than $200 MillionSpotify’s deal with Joe Rogan, the popular podcast host who has attracted a swarm of controversy in recent weeks, is worth more than $200 million, according to a new report by the New York Times. Variety confirmed the figure via a source knowledge of the pact.Citing anonymous sources, the Times reported that “the true value” of the deal negotiated between Spotify and Rogan — spanning three and a half years — was “at least $200 million, with the possibility of more.” Previously, the pact had been said to be worth more than $100 million, as first reported by the Wall Street Journal.https://news.yahoo.com/joe-rogan-deal-spotify-actually-202442278.htmlI saw some of the highlights from JRE's podcast with Coffeezilla. Excellent content for sure. Joe Rogan and Coffee did a great job breaking down every aspect of things on a play by play basis.

comments.author: rdbase
comments.body: Much agreed with you @hydrogen both make a good team. Rogan being the platform where to get the warhorn blown and Coffeezilla being the catalyst to spark up the fire against these scam artists and fraudsters out in the open.There was a piece he had did against another cryptoscam which is still causing contagion in the markets.Celsius and it's founder Alex Mashinsky.Exposing a Billion Dollar Fraudhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d3d8bRDAP3sHe had just released another one an hour ago about the latest fraud of the big banks Signature & SVB collapsing and going bankrupt in the US and Europe.Banks Are Collapsing. Here's Why - Jim Cramer said to buy SVB and Signature bank stock.https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oHjDCC6Vigc

comments.author: Carlton Banks
comments.body: Quote from: Hydrogen on March 13, 2023, 11:16:51 PMJoe Rogan is a multi millionaire through his deal with spotify.His net worth could be greater than $200 million.Joe Rogan Deal With Spotify Is Actually Worth More Than $200 Million$200 million, in actual dollars? can't help thinking Spotify paid him using Spotfiy stock for at least a little of that feeQuote from: Hydrogen on March 13, 2023, 11:16:51 PMJoe Rogan and Coffee did a great job breaking down every aspect of things on a play by play basis.I don't really trust Joe Rogan. mostly everyone these days know that new crypto promotions are scams, how does it help that he's getting on guests to tell people "this specific one is a scam"it's quite similar to saying "i'll tell you the scams, which means all the other crypto schemes are _not_ scams"which is for sure not true.

comments.author: rdbase
comments.body: Quote from: Carlton Banks on March 14, 2023, 03:00:48 PMQuote from: Hydrogen on March 13, 2023, 11:16:51 PMJoe Rogan is a multi millionaire through his deal with spotify.His net worth could be greater than $200 million.Joe Rogan Deal With Spotify Is Actually Worth More Than $200 Million$200 million, in actual dollars? can't help thinking Spotify paid him using Spotfiy stock for at least a little of that feeQuote from: Hydrogen on March 13, 2023, 11:16:51 PMJoe Rogan and Coffee did a great job breaking down every aspect of things on a play by play basis.I don't really trust Joe Rogan. mostly everyone these days know that new crypto promotions are scams, how does it help that he's getting on guests to tell people "this specific one is a scam"it's quite similar to saying "i'll tell you the scams, which means all the other crypto schemes are _not_ scams"which is for sure not true.No, they paid him in Spottycoin.Actually if they did something like you had laid out for paying him for his restitution inuse of their platform to stream the show from.It sounds more of just like what Sam Bankman-Fried did during his scamrun of FTX. Paying everybody with the FTT token which is worth pennies on the dollar by now since it's failure.SVB seemed to want to take a page out of Sam's book and try and raise capital as fast as they could.Doesn't that just sound so familiar for a corporate entity to bully around it's investors and steal their funds from right under their noses?Joe Rogan is crypto clueless and he doesn't try to hide it during his interviews with guest who are so called experts in the space.And most if not all of his audience are the same way. Up until someone like Stephen Findeisen comes along and tries to clear things up a bit for the nescient towards cryptocurrencies and how these newly made projects are mostly trying to scam their customers eventually at the end by rugging them all.

Up until someone like Stephen Findeisen comes along and tries to clear things up a bit for the nescient towards cryptocurrencies and how these newly made projects are mostly trying to scam their customers eventually at the end by rugging them all.You are right many are still crypto clueless which is why this is good for the Crypto community for those clueless to have an idea about cryptocurrency but because of the bad reputation Coffeezilla is exposing in Joe Rogan's podcast it could either be good or bad for the community,  this will surely vary depending on peoples mindset, in what they want to think crypto as a bad thing or a good thing, and I think this is just perfect for the community for certain clueless to not trust crypto fully so they can have caution in getting in with crypto space, For everyone that still doesn't watch the episode of the Coffeezilla interview on the Joe Rogan podcast here is the video, just click the picture, And this is Coffeezilla's latest video of Banks Are Collapsing that is a great video that all of us can get knowledge Here is the video just click the picture,

comments.author: DapanasFruit
comments.body: I am not actually an avid follower of these people like Coffeezilla and Joe Rogan but I always admire people who are doing their best to exposed frauds and scams in this expanding industry. Like it or not, the crypto industry has become a milking cow for many scammers, fraudsters, hackers and similar evil people all ready to fool possible victims out of their hard-earned money. We should be supporting thee people who are contributing a lot to clean this industry of bad players.

comments.author: rdbase
comments.body: Quote from: YuginKadoya on March 15, 2023, 07:39:04 AMAnd this is Coffeezilla's latest video of Banks Are Collapsing that is a great video that all of us can get knowledge Here is the video just click the picture, Jim Cramer has got to be the worst forecaster of the stock market with his "They will never fail!" speech of Silicon Valley Bank:Jim Cramer's Genius Thoughts About Silicon Valley Bank (SVB)https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3vkZMbTdV3Qand another oneJim Cramer Reports "Business as Usual" for First Republic Bankhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yNWlo3GHLI4This individual is a pure clown and should be fired from Cnbc for giving false advice due to being a complete and utter laughing stock of the whole financial business analysts world at this point.

comments.author: rdbase
comments.body: He did put out a video abit after his appearance on JRE with explanation on why he did it and some behind the scenes with Rogan.Exposing Scams on Joe Roganhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5t9AQX0Hd9oThis one wouldn't be a surprise to most who have seen his previous hit pieces on exposing the nature of these crooked and scammer type individuals who prey on the weak minded via the platform youtube:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AaB9vgMBoSYYouTubers Get Sued For $1,000,000,000 - for promoting FTX to their millions of followers

comments.author: danherbias07
comments.created_time: March 28, 2023, 11:58:30 PMLast edit: March 29, 2023, 11:34:40 AM by danherbias07
comments.body: But I do think BitBoy Crypto will get away from the lawsuit if ever this goes way far. I mean, there are proofs that he saw through what is happening and warned the investors about it and it's all over social media and the popular streaming service. Coffezilla tells he got lucky but I don't think that is the case, that may be because of long research and he found some gray spots that would make him back out on investing in FTX and supporting them. And that was before the collapse of SBF. And BitBoy is not done yet at reporting about what is happening with SBF, he may really want to dig deep into this and see that even their smallest connection will pay for what happened. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=85CKosy1iC4Man, these crypto influencers should really be careful about who or what they will promote. It's not safe in this industry.  About his Stake.com sponsorship included in the clip, I do not have many comments about it but I do believe Stake.com is good at picking sweet cherries. i.e. Adesanya, Grasso
